content.raw: just noticed the unaddressed comment in the above pull request. Ya, we should just remove the TODO comment and the two lines below
content.html: just noticed the unaddressed comment in the above pull request. Ya, we should just remove the TODO comment and the two lines below

content.raw: right, I think the commented line is completely spurious, because the Publisher isn't getting saved and isn't used. I think commenting it is fine. Also not sure what the issue is or if it's tracked in the issue tracker. *shrug*
content.html: right, I think the commented line is completely spurious, because the Publisher isn't getting saved and isn't used. I think commenting it is fine. Also not sure what the issue is or if it's tracked in the issue tracker. shrug

content.raw:
The `OriginVisual` test passes, but I find it strange that this warning comes up:

```
[Wrn] [Event.cc:87] Warning: Deleteing a connection right after creation. Make sure to save the ConnectionPtr from a Connect call
```

Where is this coming from? It's probably not a big deal, just curious since `Connect` isn't getting called directly in the test.
content.html:
The OriginVisual test passes, but I find it strange that this warning comes up:

[Wrn] [Event.cc:87] Warning: Deleteing a connection right after creation. Make sure to save the ConnectionPtr from a Connect call

Where is this coming from? It's probably not a big deal, just curious since Connect isn't getting called directly in the test.

content.raw: Louise: "Are you talking about the sun?"

Actually the 2nd line was un-commented when [pimplizing](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1385/pimplized-scene-class/activity#comment-4703284) Scene, and everytime I run into this I feel like commenting it, so I just did it now, totally out of place. Not even sure what the issue is.
content.html: Actually the 2nd line was un-commented when pimplizing Scene, and everytime I run into this I feel like commenting it, so I just did it now, totally out of place. Not even sure what the issue is.

content.raw:
slightly related question... What is the green rectangle outline with a line through it that I always see at (0, 0, z) of Gazebo (where z is a high value)?

![greenthing.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/17622756-greenthing.png)
content.html: slightly related question... What is the green rectangle outline with a line through it that I always see at (0, 0, z) of Gazebo (where z is a high value)?

content.raw: since you commented out line 168, is this TODO still needed, or does it refer to the Subscribe call?

content.raw: Can you make the origin visual more like the origin visual in Sketchup and Blender? They use long solid (and/or dashed) lines without arrows. The length of the line help to differentiate the origin visual from a joint, and also allows you to have some reference information when moving the camera away from the origin point.
content.html: Can you make the origin visual more like the origin visual in Sketchup and Blender? They use long solid (and/or dashed) lines without arrows. The length of the line help to differentiate the origin visual from a joint, and also allows you to have some reference information when moving the camera away from the origin point.
